message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

The paper deals with deep learning methods for 3D object detection and metric shape retrieval using monocular images. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO) categories. The paper also proposes a novel loss formulation, which involves lifting 2D detection to 3D space, and optimizing for 6D pose and metric shape. This involves using deep learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and regression models, which are commonly used in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on the KITTI3D dataset, which involves 3D object detection and tracking in autonomous driving scenarios, and this falls under the graphics (cs.GR) category.
